intro: Salsola triandra, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, characterized by its succulent, spine-tipped leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant is well adapted to harsh environments, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in poor soils and extreme temperatures. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution and invasive potential in some areas. Salsola triandra plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for livestock in certain ecosystems.
